snippet: Sergey Aleynikov is being tried for the second time on charges he stole some of the source code to Goldman Sachs’s high-frequency trading program.
abstract: New York Supreme Court Justice Daniel P Conviser rules that prosecution in state's case against former Goldman Sachs programmer Sergey Aleynikov cannot call expert witness; Aleynikov is accused of stealing source code from Goldman and is being tried under New York State laws governing corporate espionage.
lead_paragraph: Sergey Aleynikov is being tried for the second time on charges he stole some of the source code to Goldman Sachs’s high-frequency trading program.

headline.main: New Stumbles by Prosecutors in Trial of Former Goldman Programmer
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Testimony Denied in Trial of Ex-Goldman Programmer
